intro: Osteomeles obovata, commonly known as the broad-leaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink or red. The plant has broad, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Osteomeles obovata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
